thread.title: Book reviews: Sweet Wattle Creek, The Secret Years, The Patterson Girls
thread.title_full: Book reviews: Sweet Wattle Creek, The Secret Years, The Patterson Girls

author: Karen Hardy
title: Book reviews: Sweet Wattle Creek, The Secret Years, The Patterson Girls
text:
Sweet Wattle Creek
By Kaye Dobbie. Harlequin Australia. $29.99. 
The chance discovery of an old wedding dress kicks off this story, weaving together the lives of three young women from different eras. It's 1931 and Belle heads back to rural Sweet Wattle Creek to claim her inheritance, a run-down grand hotel formerly owned by Martha. Why did Martha leave the hotel to Belle? And, 60 years down the track when Sophie discovers an old wedding dress, the lives of the three women become even more intertwined. Touches on the issues of domestic violence, grief and identity but most of all it's a story of building a life in rural Australia. Enjoyable.
The Secret Years
By Barbara Hannay. Michael Joseph. $32.99. 
Another chance discovery, this time an old photograph, unlocks the secrets to Lucy's family, a story that stretches from remote cattle farms of Queensland to London society. As the story moves between the present and the Second World War, we're introduced to a wonderful set of characters who engage and delight us. Georgina Lenton finds forbidden love with a cattleman and defies her family and the odds to set up a new life. Can Lucy do the same? There's romance and adventure and a tidy ending. Hannay is an award-winning romance writer and is bound to become a new favourite if you enjoy the genre.
Advertisement The Patterson Girls
By Rachael Johns. Harlequin MIRA. $29.99. 
Yes, another discovery that reveals some family secrets. There's always a theme. The Patterson girls, four sisters, return home from corners of the globe to comfort their grieving father after the sudden death of their mother. They're all battling issues of their own. Infertility, achieving work life balance, failing relationships. Can they reconnect and find happiness, can they put aside past differences? There'll be something you'll identify with in each sister and you'll be questioning your own family dynamics. A story of love and redemption that will surprise you.
